summary: The Air Force identified more than half of its $398 billion in assets (i.e., aircraft, weapons, vehicles, buildings) as mission-critical in fiscal year 2019. But, for decades, the service has not been accurately tracking and reporting financial information about its mission-critical assets. Without reliable information on this, the Air Force can’t support informed decisions about the condition, cost, or reliability of its assets, or about...
title: Air Force: Enhanced Enterprise Risk Management and Internal Control Assessments Could Improve Accountability over Mission-Critical Assets
